column4: Alright so this is what I have in my computer a Core2 duo , a P965 motherboard and 6GB of DDR2 RAM... I just switched to the 64 bit version of Ubuntu why is my RAM not showing up in the System Monitor tool thing on my toolbar
try the command: free
Newest stable yeah 3.5 is the one I think
run: alsamixer   are all levels unmuted and cranked?
can you give the url generated by: wget -O alsa-info.sh http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh; chmod +x ./alsa-info.sh; ./alsa-info.sh
i'd add the text from the generated link to your forum
try: options snd-hda-intel model=targa-dig-8ch    in /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf  and reboot, may help
you need to find the option to make yours work
most will be
what video have you seen?
oh you mean flash isn't working?
can you use a PASTEBIN and give the output of:  lsb_release -a; uname -a; dpkg -l | egrep 'flash|gnash|swf|spark'
I said pastebin. I even put it in caps...
think about it....
I put it in caps
why did you STILL paste in here
If yo make a pastebin that wont't happen, which is why I said to make a pastebin...
paste the text in the pastebin, and click the paste button. When the screen changes copy the new url in the address bar and paste THAT in the channel
if you dodn't know, why didn't you ask how to use the pastebin?
what is the output of:    dpkg -l | egrep 'flash|gnash|swf|spark'
good enogh :)
